intro: Rhipidostigma, commonly known as the "butterfly orchid," is a genus of flowering plants in the orchid family, Orchidaceae. These plants are native to various regions in South America, particularly in the Andes. They are characterized by their unique, often colorful flowers that resemble butterflies, hence their common name. Rhipidostigma species typically grow as epiphytes or terrestrial plants, thriving in humid, shaded environments. Their botanical features include intricate floral structures and specialized root systems adapted for nutrient absorption in their natural habitats.
